{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a deep carious infection in the maxillary right lateral incisor that is non-restorable, which means the tooth cannot be saved. The symptoms such as high fever, inability to chew, facial swelling, and pain indicate a severe infection. Aspiration alone would not be sufficient to treat the infection. Antibiotics of heat only would not address the source of the infection. Incision and drainage would help to relieve the pressure and pain, but it would not treat the underlying infection. Therefore, the patient needs a combination of antibiotics to treat the infection, heat to help with the pain and swelling, and fluids to prevent dehydration.", "answer_choice": "D. Antibiotics, heat and fluid"}
